The Docs Engine strives to solve these problems by providing smart defaults with minimal

In short, docs sites built with the Cloudflare Docs Engine are
and a shell UI you that’s consistent across products, all deployed as a
The instructions below assume you already have a paid
account so you can deploy your docs site using
. You can theoretically use any static site deploy tool; however, only Workers Sites has been tested at this time.
Each docs site built with the engine needs the following structure:
with the engine dependency and some custom scripts configured.
config which exports a JavaScript object.
For a repo holding a single docs site, everything but the content should be in the root.
However, these files can also be placed inside any sub-folder of your project. When doing this, you’ll need to then customize the

needs to depend on the Docs Engine, and it needs to include scripts for bootstrapping the engine, building the project, local development, and deployment.
